name: Nicotine Lozenge
summary: A nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) in lozenge form used to aid smoking cessation by delivering nicotine orally to reduce cravings and withdrawal symptoms.
description: Nicotine lozenges are over-the-counter nicotine replacement therapy products designed to help people quit smoking by delivering a controlled dose of nicotine that is absorbed through the oral mucosa. They dissolve slowly in the mouth, releasing nicotine over 20–30 minutes to reduce cravings and withdrawal symptoms.

metadata.fda_pregnancy_category: D (risk if continued smoking outweighs use in pregnancy; NRT use should be supervised)

sections.text: Provides controlled nicotine delivery via buccal absorption as the lozenge dissolves, stimulating nicotinic acetylcholine receptors to reduce cravings and withdrawal symptoms.

adult.typical: Use one lozenge every 1–2 hours for the first 6 weeks, then gradually extend intervals
adult.strengths: 2 mg for smokers of <25 cigarettes/day; 4 mg for ≥25 cigarettes/day

sections.tapering: Reduce total lozenges per day over 12 weeks until discontinuation

sections.text: Nicotine is released over 20–30 minutes as the lozenge dissolves; peak levels occur near the end of dissolution.

other: Do not chew or swallow lozenge whole; allow to dissolve slowly in the mouth
Avoid acidic beverages 15 minutes before and during use to improve nicotine absorption

items.risk: Smoking cessation may alter drug metabolism

items: Blood pressure and heart rate in at-risk patients

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks and under supervision
sections.lactation: Nicotine passes into breast milk; avoid or use immediately after breastfeeding
sections.pediatrics: Not recommended under age 18 without medical supervision

sections.text: Gradually reduce the number of lozenges per day over a 12-week period.

items: May be preferred by patients who dislike chewing gum or have dental issues
Part of a comprehensive smoking cessation program including behavioral support

items.label: US Public Health Service Clinical Practice Guideline: Treating Tobacco Use and Dependence

seo.title: Nicotine Lozenge: Smoking Cessation Aid
seo.description: Nicotine lozenges are an over-the-counter nicotine replacement therapy that helps reduce cravings and withdrawal symptoms during smoking cessation.
